page.title: 04MARKETING THE BLAISDON PLUM
page.content: The crop comes anytime from mid August -mid September, the earliest ever recorded was 9th August 1957 when the Walton's son was born. All is { {"Plum Fever" }for the next fortnight when the lorries arrive daily from the canners and jammers. The local jam factory has closed but Marks and Spencers still make jam at Ledbury and Robertson's use Blaisdons exclusively. The plums are packed in 56lb boxes and due to E.E.C. regulations are graded for size before going to market. Unfortunately many plums not wanted by the manufacturers do not satisfy the standards and rot on the ground. The village has a biennial{Plum festival with displays of crafts and flowers and of course plums! This year promises a bumper crop.
